column3: Life Event
column4: Life Event

column3: Born in West Orange, New Jersey: Last of 8 children including 5 sisters and 2 brothers
column4: Born in West Orange, New Jersey: Last of 8 children including 5 sisters and 2 brothers

column3: Father dies at age 56
column4: Father dies at age 56

column3: First suicide attempt: mixed an assortment of chemical together from chemistry set and drank it
column4: First suicide attempt: mixed an assortment of chemical together from chemistry set and drank it

column3: 5th grade: Charles teased at school and wrote book with one of his only friends entitled Infinity Years Will Never Know about growing up in a world in which life was meaningless
column4: 5th grade: Charles teased at school and wrote book with one of his only friends entitled Infinity Years Will Never Know about growing up in a world in which life was meaningless

column3: Fascinated by the works of Dostoyevsky: Favorite book was Crime and Punishment about a man who commits murder
column4: Fascinated by the works of Dostoyevsky: Favorite book was Crime and Punishment about a man who commits murder

column3: Mother killed in a car accident
column4: Mother killed in a car accident

column3: Bullied in high school: Goes to a party and decided to fight back by lacing drinks with rat poison but no one dies
column4: Bullied in high school: Goes to a party and decided to fight back by lacing drinks with rat poison but no one dies

column3: Drops out of high school and enlists in the Navy
column4: Drops out of high school and enlists in the Navy

column3: Receives training to become a ballistic missiles technician in the Navy
column4: Receives training to become a ballistic missiles technician in the Navy

column3: Given 1st assignment aboard nuclear submarine U.S.S. Woodrow Wilson
column4: Given 1st assignment aboard nuclear submarine U.S.S. Woodrow Wilson

column3: Considered a “misfit” by crew members: Taunted, ridiculed, hazed, and given the nickname “Fish-belly”
column4: Considered a “misfit” by crew members: Taunted, ridiculed, hazed, and given the nickname “Fish-belly”

column3: Discovered sitting in stolen hospital gown, mask, and gloves at the missile control panel: Incident was reported
column4: Discovered sitting in stolen hospital gown, mask, and gloves at the missile control panel: Incident was reported

column3: Reassigned to U.S.S. Canopus
column4: Reassigned to U.S.S. Canopus

column3: Issued a discharge from the Navy: records not public whether the discharge was for medical or psychological reasons
column4: Issued a discharge from the Navy: records not public whether the discharge was for medical or psychological reasons

column3: Enrolls in Mountainside Hospital School of Nursing in Montclair, New Jersey
Brother James dies from drug overdose
Graduates from nursing school
Marries computer programmer Adrienne Taub
Starts working in burn unit of St. Barnabus Medical Center in Livingston, New Jersey
1st daughter born
1st kill: 72-year-old John Yengo-used Lidocaine
Received numerous speeding tickets and started drinking heavily
Psychologically and physically abuses family especially during winter by turning heat off; starts torturing the family’s 2 pet Yorkshire terriers often placing them in trash bins
Fired from St. Barnabus
Begins working in Coronary Care Unit at Warren Hospital in Phillipsburg, New Jersey
2nd daughter born
Wife files domestic violence complaint and requests a restraining order that is denied by the judge
Wife files for divorce
Cullen served with divorce papers
Wife files another domestic violence complaint and requests a temporary restraining order because she feels that Charles’s access to medications could put her and daughters at risk
Attempts suicide and is sent to the Behavioral Health Unit at Muhlenberg Regional Medical Center in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania
Released and went home
Kills Lucy Mugavero, 90, at Warren Hospital with digoxin—a heart stimulant
Arrested for breaking into the home of Michelle Tomlinson
Wife applies for and granted a restraining order; has no visitation rights with his kids; Charles attempts suicide again and sent to Carrier Clinic in Belle Meade, New Jersey
Kills Mary Natoli, 85, at Warren Hospital with digoxin
Pleads guilty to trespassing and harassment of Michelle Tomlinson
Attempts suicide again
Kills Helen Dean, 91, at Warren Hospital with digoxin
Passes a polygraph during the investigation of Dean’s death
Quits job at Warren Hospital
Divorce from Adrienne finalized; Adrienne awarded custody and Charles is granted unsupervised visitation of children
Begins working at Hunterdon Medical Center in ICU in Flemington, New Jersey
Receives Pennsylvania nursing license
Receives award for diligence and hard work from colleagues; starts dating married nurse at Hunterdon
Kills Leroy Sinn, 71, with digoxin at Hunterdon
Kills Earl Young, 75, with digoxin at Hunterdon
Kills Catherine Dext, 49, with digoxin at Hunterdon
Kills Frank Mazzacco, 65, with digoxin at Hunterdon
Kills Jesse Eichlin, 81, with digoxin at Hunterdon
Girlfriend dumps him; quits job at Hunterdon
Starts working at Morristown Memorial Hospital in Morristown, New Jersey
Fired from Morristown Memorial Hospital for poor job performance
Hired by Liberty Nursing Home and Rehabilitation Center in Allentown, Pennsylvania
Cullen declares bankruptcy
Cullen fired from Liberty after “accidentally” breaking a patient’s arm
Starts working part-time at Easton Hospital ICU in Easton, Pennsylvania
Starts working as a night nurse in burn unit of Lehigh Valley Hospital in Salisbury Township, New Jersey
Kills Ottomar Schramm, 78, with digoxin at Easton Hospital
Kills Matthew Mattern, 22, with digoxin at Lehigh Valley Hospital
Attempts suicide again via carbon monoxide; sent to Warren County Crisis Center
Attempts to kill Stella Danielczyk with an overdose of digoxin
Leaves Lehigh Valley Hospital
Starts working at St. Luke’s Hospital in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania
Charles’s brother, Edmond, dies of brain cancer
Kills Irene Krapf, 79, with digoxin at St. Luke’s
Kills William Park, 72, with digoxin at St. Luke’s
Kills Samuel Spangler, 80, with digoxin at St. Luke’s
Kills Daniel George, 82, with digoxin at St. Luke’s
Kills Edward O’ Toole, 76, with digoxin at St. Luke’s
Resigns from St. Luke’s after the hospital’s growing suspicions of him
Starts working and quits Sacred Heart Hospital in Allentown, Pennsylvania due to rumors circulating about him
St. Luke’s reports “probable unprofessional conduct” to Pennsylvania state nursing board
Starts working at Somerset Medical Center in Somerset, New Jersey
Pennsylvania state nursing board starts an investigation of Cullen’s activities while employed at St. Luke’s
Investigation completed and findings shared with police
Kills Elenor Stoecker, 60, with digoxin at Somerset Medical Center
Kills Joyce Mangini, 74, with digoxin at Somerset Medical Center
Kills Giacomino Toto, 89, with digoxin at Somerset Medical Center
Kills John Shanagher, 83, with norepinephrine at Somerset Medical Center
Kills Dorthea Hoagland, 80, with norepinephrine at Somerset Medical Center
Kills Melvin Simcoe, 66, with sodium nitroprusside at Somerset Medical Center
Michael Strenko, 21, with norepinephrine at Somerset Medical Center
Attempts to kill 40-year-old Jin Kung Han with digoxin
Kills Florian Gall, 68, with digoxin at Somerset Medical Center
Kills Pasquale Napolitano, 80, with dobutamine at Somerset Medical Center
Kills Chris Hardgrove, 38, with norepinephrine at Somerset Medical Center
Attempts to kill 80-year-old Frances Agoada
Kills Krishnakant Upadhyay, 70, with digoxin at Somerset Medical Center
Kills James Strickland, 83, with digoxin at Somerset Medical Center
Somerset Medical Center reports suspicious deaths to Somerset County Prosecutor’s Office
Kills Edward Zizik, 73, with digoxin at Somerset Medical Center
Gall’s body exhumed and autopsy revealed that he died from deliberate overdose
Cullen fired from Somerset and New Jersey police request his employment records
Cullen arrested and taken to Somerset County jail
Tells police during interrogation that he has administered 30-40 lethal drug injections during his 16-year career as a nurse
column4: Tells police during interrogation that he has administered 30-40 lethal drug injections during his 16-year career as a nurse

column3: Charged with the murder of Gall and attempted murder of Han
column4: Charged with the murder of Gall and attempted murder of Han

column3: Transferred to Trenton State Psychiatric Hospital
column4: Transferred to Trenton State Psychiatric Hospital

column3: Cullen surrenders his New Jersey nursing license
column4: Cullen surrenders his New Jersey nursing license

column3: Cullen’s public defender announces that his client won’t help with the investigation unless authorities agree not to seek the death penalty
column4: Cullen’s public defender announces that his client won’t help with the investigation unless authorities agree not to seek the death penalty

column3: Cullen returns to Somerset County Jail
column4: Cullen returns to Somerset County Jail

column3: Cullen pleads guilty to murder of 13 patients and the attempted murder of 2 patients at Somerset Medical Center
column4: Cullen pleads guilty to murder of 13 patients and the attempted murder of 2 patients at Somerset Medical Center

column3: Pleads guilty to murdering 3 people at Warren Hospital
column4: Pleads guilty to murdering 3 people at Warren Hospital

column3: Pleads guilty to murdering Ottomar Schramm at Easton Hospital
column4: Pleads guilty to murdering Ottomar Schramm at Easton Hospital

column3: Charged with 6 more murder charges in Lehigh County
column4: Charged with 6 more murder charges in Lehigh County

column3: Pleads guilty to the murder of 5 patients at St. Luke’s as well as 1 murder and 3 attempted murders at Lehigh Valley Hospital
column4: Pleads guilty to the murder of 5 patients at St. Luke’s as well as 1 murder and 3 attempted murders at Lehigh Valley Hospital

column3: Pleads guilty to the 1988 murder of John Yengo
column4: Pleads guilty to the 1988 murder of John Yengo

column3: Government launches an investigation of the hospitals where Cullen worked to see if federal laws were broken by a failure to act more promptly against Cullen
column4: Government launches an investigation of the hospitals where Cullen worked to see if federal laws were broken by a failure to act more promptly against Cullen

column3: Cullen pleads guilty to 5 murders committed at Hunterdon Medical Center
column4: Cullen pleads guilty to 5 murders committed at Hunterdon Medical Center

column3: Press releases that Cullen wants to donate his kidney to a relative of an ex-girlfriend
column4: Press releases that Cullen wants to donate his kidney to a relative of an ex-girlfriend

column3: Press releases that Cullen has stopped cooperating with investigators and demands to be sentenced so he would be free to proceed with the transplant operation, if permitted
column4: Press releases that Cullen has stopped cooperating with investigators and demands to be sentenced so he would be free to proceed with the transplant operation, if permitted

column3:
Cullen is confronted by family members of victims and sentenced to 11 
consecutive life terms for the murder of 22 and the attempted murder of 3 in New Jersey. This means that he will not be eligible for parole until he has served 397 years. Cullen will be sentenced at a later date for the murder of 7 and the attempted murder of 3 in Pennsylvania.
column4:
Cullen is confronted by family members of victims and sentenced to 11 
consecutive life terms for the murder of 22 and the attempted murder of 3 in New Jersey. This means that he will not be eligible for parole until he has served 397 years. Cullen will be sentenced at a later date for the murder of 7 and the attempted murder of 3 in Pennsylvania.

column3: Press releases that a New Jersey judge has agreed to allow Cullen to donate his kidney
column4: Press releases that a New Jersey judge has agreed to allow Cullen to donate his kidney
